member.name: T:Alaris.Strategy.Bridge.STBR001A
member.summary: Unified pricing engine that automatically selects between Alaris.Double and Alaris.Quantlib based on interest rate regime. Supports both positive and negative interest rates.
member.remarks: Regime Detection: - If r >= 0: Use Alaris.Quantlib (standard American option pricing) - If r < 0 and q < r: Use Alaris.Double (double boundary method for negative rates) - If r < 0 and q >= r: Use Alaris.Quantlib (single boundary still applies)

member.name: T:Alaris.Strategy.Core.Numerical.STPR002A
member.summary: Adaptive numerical integration using MathNet.Numerics. Production-grade implementation for integrating characteristic functions in option pricing.

member.name: M:Alaris.Strategy.Core.Numerical.STPR002A.Integrate(System.Func{System.Double,System.Double},System.Double,System.Double,System.Double,System.Double)
member.summary: Integrates a real-valued function over a finite interval using high-order Gauss-Legendre quadrature.

member.name: M:Alaris.Strategy.Core.Numerical.STPR002A.IntegrateToInfinity(System.Func{System.Double,System.Double},System.Double,System.Double,System.Double)
member.summary:
Integrates from a to infinity using Adaptive Truncation with Gauss-Legendre.
Instead of mapping (a, inf) -> (-1, 1), we integrate in chunks [a, a+step], [a+step, a+2*step]... until the contribution of a chunk is smaller than the tolerance. This is superior for oscillatory Characteristic Functions (Heston/Kou).

member.name: M:Alaris.Strategy.Core.Numerical.STPR002A.IntegrateComplexToInfinity(System.Func{System.Double,System.Numerics.Complex},System.Double,System.Double,System.Double)
member.summary: Integrates a complex function from a to infinity using Adaptive Truncation.

member.name: T:Alaris.Strategy.Core.Numerical.STPR005A
member.summary:
Production-grade Differential Evolution optimizer for global optimization. Particularly effective for non-convex, multi-modal objective functions.
DE is a population-based stochastic optimization algorithm that: - Doesn't require gradient information - Handles non-smooth, non-convex objectives - Good at escaping local minima - Robust for calibrating jump-diffusion models
References: Storn and Price (1997) "Differential Evolution - A Simple and Efficient Heuristic for Global Optimization over Continuous Spaces"

member.name: P:Alaris.Strategy.Core.Numerical.STPR005A.PopulationSize
member.summary: Population size (typically 10 * dimension). 0 means auto-select.

member.name: P:Alaris.Strategy.Core.Numerical.STPR005A.MaxGenerations
member.summary: Maximum number of generations.

member.name: P:Alaris.Strategy.Core.Numerical.STPR005A.DifferentialWeight
member.summary: Differential weight F ∈ [0, 2], typically 0.8. Controls the amplification of differential variation.

member.name: P:Alaris.Strategy.Core.Numerical.STPR005A.CrossoverProbability
member.summary: Crossover probability CR ∈ [0, 1], typically 0.9. Controls the fraction of parameter values copied from the mutant.

member.name: P:Alaris.Strategy.Core.Numerical.STPR005A.Tolerance
member.summary: Tolerance for convergence (standard deviation of population objective values).

member.summary: Random number generator seed (null for random).

member.summary: Minimizes an objective function using Differential Evolution.

member.name: T:Alaris.Strategy.Core.STCR003AEstimator
member.summary: Implements the Yang-Zhang (2000) realized volatility estimator. This estimator is an efficient method that uses OHLC data and accounts for opening jumps. Formula: RV² = σ_o² + k·σ_c² + (1-k)·σ_rs²
member.remarks: Optimized for Rule 5 (Zero-Allocation Hot Paths) using ArrayPool and Span<T>.

member.summary: Calculates the Yang-Zhang realized volatility estimate.

member.summary: Calculates log returns directly into provided arrays (zero allocation).

member.summary: Calculates Yang-Zhang variance from Span return components (zero allocation).

member.summary: Calculates sample variance using (n-1) denominator from Span.

member.summary: Gets or sets the calibrated earnings jump volatility (sigma_e) from historical EA moves. This is the standard deviation of log-returns on earnings announcement dates. Reference: Leung & Santoli (2014) Section 5.2

member.summary: Gets or sets the theoretical pre-EA implied volatility from L&S model. Formula: I(t) = sqrt(sigma^2 + sigma_e^2 / (T-t)) Reference: Leung & Santoli (2014) Equation 2.4

member.name: P:Alaris.Strategy.Core.STCR004A.IVMispricingSTCR004A
member.summary: Gets or sets the IV mispricing signal (market IV - theoretical IV). Positive: market IV overpriced relative to historical earnings behavior. Negative: market IV underpriced relative to historical earnings behavior.

member.summary: Gets or sets the expected IV crush magnitude in volatility points. Computed as: pre-EA IV - base volatility (sigma)

member.summary: Gets or sets the IV crush ratio (crush / pre-EA IV). Represents the expected percentage drop in IV after earnings.

member.summary: Gets or sets the base (diffusion) volatility sigma. This is the volatility excluding the earnings jump component.

member.name: P:Alaris.Strategy.Core.STCR004A.BackExpiry

member.name: P:Alaris.Strategy.Core.STCR004A.BackIV
member.summary: Gets or sets the back-month implied volatility. Expected to be lower as it spans beyond the earnings event.

member.name: T:Alaris.Strategy.Core.STIV001A
member.summary:
Implements the Heston (1993) stochastic volatility model for implied volatility.
Stock price dynamics under risk-neutral measure Q: dS/S = (r - d)dt + sqrt(V)*dW_S dV = kappa*(theta - V)dt + sigma_v*sqrt(V)*dW_V corr(dW_S, dW_V) = rho
Where: V = instantaneous variance theta = long-run variance (mean reversion level) kappa = mean reversion speed sigma_v = volatility of volatility (vol-of-vol) rho = correlation between stock and variance
The model captures: 1. Volatility clustering (mean reversion) 2. Leverage effect (negative correlation) 3. Implied volatility smile/skew
Martingale condition: The drift (r-d) ensures discounted stock price is a martingale. Feller condition: 2*kappa*theta > sigma_v^2 ensures variance stays positive.
Reference: "A Closed-Form Solution for Options with Stochastic Volatility with Applications to Bond and Currency Options" S.L. Heston (1993), Review of Financial Studies

member.summary: Computes theoretical implied volatility using moment-matching approximation. LEGACY VERSION: Fast approximation for educational/comparison purposes. For production use, prefer ComputeTheoreticalIV() which uses full pricing.

member.summary: Computes expected integrated variance E[int_0^T V_s ds].

member.name: T:Alaris.Strategy.Core.STIV002A
member.summary:
Implements the Kou (2002) double-exponential jump-diffusion model for implied volatility.
The model extends Black-Scholes with Poisson jumps where jump sizes follow a double-exponential (asymmetric Laplace) distribution, capturing: 1. Asymmetric jump sizes (upward vs downward moves) 2. Leptokurtic returns (fat tails) 3. Implied volatility skew
Stock price dynamics under risk-neutral measure Q: dS/S = (r - d - lambda*kappa)dt + sigma*dW + d(sum(V_i - 1))
Where: sigma = diffusion volatility lambda = jump intensity (jumps per year) V_i = jump multiplier with double-exponential distribution kappa = E[V-1] = p*eta1/(eta1-1) + (1-p)*eta2/(eta2+1) - 1
The (r - d - lambda*kappa) drift ensures the martingale condition.
Reference: "A Jump-Diffusion Model for Option Pricing" S.G. Kou (2002), Management Science

member.name: T:Alaris.Strategy.Core.STIV003A
member.summary:
Selects the optimal IV model based on market conditions, fit metrics, and regime. Implements automatic model selection with martingale condition enforcement.
Model Selection Criteria: 1. Regime detection (pre/post earnings, normal) 2. Fit quality (RMSE, MAE on calibration data) 3. Parsimony (AIC/BIC penalizing complexity) 4. Martingale constraint satisfaction 5. Out-of-sample validation
Available Models: - Black-Scholes: Baseline, no parameters to calibrate - Leung-Santoli: Pre-earnings with deterministic jump - Heston: Stochastic volatility for smile/skew - Kou: Jump-diffusion for fat tails and asymmetry

member.name: T:Alaris.Strategy.Core.STIV004A
member.summary:
Implements the Leung & Santoli (2014) pre-earnings announcement implied volatility model.
The model accounts for scheduled earnings jumps in option pricing by incorporating a deterministic-time random jump in the stock price dynamics. The pre-EA implied volatility follows: I(t; K, T) = sqrt(sigma^2 + sigma_e^2 / (T - t))
Where: sigma = base (diffusion) volatility sigma_e = earnings jump volatility (calibrated from historical EA moves) T = option expiration time t = current time (must be before EA date T_e)
Reference: "Accounting for Earnings Announcements in the Pricing of Equity Options" Tim Leung & Marco Santoli (2014), Journal of Derivatives

member.name: F:Alaris.Strategy.Core.STIV004A.MinTimeToExpiry
member.summary: Minimum time to expiry to avoid division by zero (1 hour in years).

member.name: M:Alaris.Strategy.Core.STIV004A.ComputeTheoreticalIV(System.Double,System.Double,System.Double)
member.summary: Computes the theoretical pre-earnings announcement implied volatility.
member.param: Time to option expiration in years (T - t).
member.returns: The theoretical implied volatility I(t; K, T).

member.name: M:Alaris.Strategy.Core.STIV004A.ComputeMispricingSTCR004A(System.Double,System.Double,System.Double,System.Double)
member.summary: Computes the IV mispricing signal by comparing market IV to theoretical L&S IV. Positive values indicate market IV is higher than theoretical (potentially overpriced). Negative values indicate market IV is lower than theoretical (potentially underpriced).
member.param: Time to option expiration in years (T - t).
member.returns: The mispricing signal (market IV - theoretical IV).

member.name: M:Alaris.Strategy.Core.STIV004A.ComputeExpectedIVCrush(System.Double,System.Double,System.Double)
member.summary: Computes the expected IV crush magnitude after earnings announcement. This represents the drop from pre-EA IV to post-EA IV.
member.param: Time to option expiration in years (T - t).
member.returns: The expected IV crush in volatility points.

member.summary: Computes the IV crush ratio (relative magnitude of expected crush).
member.param: Time to option expiration in years (T - t).
member.returns: The IV crush as a percentage of pre-EA IV.

member.summary: Extracts the earnings jump volatility (sigma_e) from observed market IV. This is the inverse of the L&S formula, solving for sigma_e given market IV.
member.param: Time to option expiration in years (T - t).
member.returns: The implied earnings jump volatility sigma_e.

member.name: M:Alaris.Strategy.Core.STIV004A.ComputeSTTM001A(System.Double,System.Double,System.Int32[])
member.summary: Computes the term structure of theoretical IV at different DTEs. Useful for comparing against market term structure.

member.name: T:Alaris.Strategy.Core.STIV005A
member.summary:
Calibrates earnings jump volatility (sigma_e) from historical earnings announcement data.
The earnings jump volatility represents the standard deviation of log-returns on earnings announcement dates, as specified in Leung & Santoli (2014). This parameter is crucial for: 1. Computing theoretical pre-EA implied volatility 2. Estimating expected IV crush magnitude 3. Identifying mispricing in market IV vs theoretical IV
Calibration approach: sigma_e = sqrt(Var(Z_e)) where Z_e is the log-return on EA date Empirically: sigma_e = StdDev(log(S_t+1 / S_t)) for historical EA dates
Reference: "Accounting for Earnings Announcements in the Pricing of Equity Options" Leung & Santoli (2014), Section 5.2 - Analytic Estimators under the Extended BS Model

member.name: F:Alaris.Strategy.Core.STIV005A.MinHistoricalSamples
member.summary: Minimum number of historical earnings to compute reliable sigma_e.

member.summary: Default lookback period for historical earnings (quarters).

member.summary: Maximum reasonable sigma_e (100% daily move).

member.summary: Calibrates earnings jump volatility from historical earnings moves.
member.returns: Calibrated sigma_e, or null if insufficient data.

member.summary: Calibrates earnings jump volatility from historical price data and earnings dates.
member.returns: Calibration result with sigma_e and statistics.

member.name: M:Alaris.Strategy.Core.STIV005A.STTM001AEstimator(System.Double,System.Int32,System.Double,System.Int32)
member.summary: Computes the term structure estimator from two IV observations. From Leung & Santoli (2014) Section 5.2, Equation 5.2: sigma_e^TS = sqrt((IV(T1)^2 - IV(T2)^2) / (1/(T1-t) - 1/(T2-t)))
member.param: Days to expiry for first maturity.
Implied volatility for second maturity (dte2 > dte1).
Days to expiry for second maturity.
member.returns: Term structure estimator of sigma_e, or null if invalid.

member.summary: Computes the base volatility (sigma) from term structure observations. From Leung & Santoli (2014) Section 5.2: sigma^TS = sqrt(((T1-t)*IV(T1)^2 - (T2-t)*IV(T2)^2) / (T1 - T2))
member.param: Days to expiry for first maturity.
Days to expiry for second maturity.
member.returns: Term structure estimator of base volatility sigma, or null if invalid.

member.name: T:Alaris.Strategy.Core.STPR003A
member.summary:
Production-grade Heston model pricing using characteristic function integration. Implements the semi-analytical pricing formula from Heston (1993). Uses Carr-Madan Fourier inversion or Lewis (2001) approach for option pricing, then backs out implied volatility using Newton-Raphson iteration.
References: Heston (1993) "A Closed-Form Solution for Options with Stochastic Volatility" Carr and Madan (1999) "Option Valuation Using the Fast Fourier Transform" Lewis (2001) "A Simple Option Formula for General Jump-Diffusion and Other Exponential Levy Processes" Leung and Santoli (2014) "Accounting for Earnings Announcements in the Pricing of Equity Options" - Extended Heston with EA jumps

member.summary:
Production-grade Kou model pricing using characteristic function integration. Implements semi-analytical pricing for double-exponential jump-diffusion model.
The Kou (2002) model extends Black-Scholes with asymmetric jumps: - Uses Fourier inversion for option pricing - Handles fat tails and skewness - Calibrates to market implied volatility smile
References: Kou (2002) "A Jump-Diffusion Model for Option Pricing", Management Science Carr and Madan (1999) "Option Valuation Using the Fast Fourier Transform"

member.name: T:Alaris.Strategy.Cost.STCS001A
member.summary: Defines the contract for execution cost models.

remarks.para: This interface abstracts the computation of transaction costs, enabling pluggable implementations ranging from simple constant fees to sophisticated brokerage-specific models (e.g., InteractiveBrokersFeeModel via Alaris.Lean).
Implementations must compute costs deterministically given the same inputs, supporting reproducible backtesting and strategy validation.

member.name: P:Alaris.Strategy.Cost.STCS001A.ModelName
member.summary: Gets the name of the cost model for logging and identification.

member.name: M:Alaris.Strategy.Cost.STCS001A.ComputeOptionCost(Alaris.Strategy.Cost.STCS002A)
member.summary: Computes the execution cost for an option order.

member.name: M:Alaris.Strategy.Cost.STCS001A.ComputeSpreadCost(Alaris.Strategy.Cost.STCS002A,Alaris.Strategy.Cost.STCS002A)
member.summary: Computes the execution cost for a calendar spread order.
member.returns: The combined execution cost for the spread.
member.exception: Thrown when either parameter is null.

member.name: T:Alaris.Strategy.Cost.STCS002A
member.summary: Represents the parameters required for computing execution costs.

remarks.para: This immutable record captures all market data necessary to compute realistic execution costs, including bid-ask spreads for slippage estimation and premium information for tiered fee structures.
Reference: InteractiveBrokersFeeModel uses premium to determine fee tiers for equity options (see Alaris.Lean fee model documentation).

member.name: P:Alaris.Strategy.Cost.STCS002A.Contracts
member.summary: Gets the number of contracts in the order.
member.remarks: Must be positive for valid orders.

member.name: P:Alaris.Strategy.Cost.STCS002A.MidPrice
member.summary: Gets the mid-price of the option.
member.remarks: Computed as (Bid + Ask) / 2. Used as the theoretical fill price in simulations before applying slippage.

member.name: P:Alaris.Strategy.Cost.STCS002A.BidPrice
member.summary: Gets the bid price of the option.

member.name: P:Alaris.Strategy.Cost.STCS002A.AskPrice
member.summary: Gets the ask price of the option.

member.name: P:Alaris.Strategy.Cost.STCS002A.Direction
member.summary: Gets the order direction.

member.name: P:Alaris.Strategy.Cost.STCS002A.Premium
member.summary: Gets the option premium per share (for tiered fee calculation).
member.remarks: For IBKR fee model: premium < $0.05, $0.05 ≤ premium < $0.10, premium ≥ $0.10 determine fee tiers of $0.25, $0.50, $0.70 per contract respectively.

member.name: P:Alaris.Strategy.Cost.STCS002A.ContractMultiplier
member.summary: Gets the contract multiplier (typically 100 for equity options).

member.name: P:Alaris.Strategy.Cost.STCS002A.Symbol
member.summary: Gets the underlying symbol for reference.

member.name: P:Alaris.Strategy.Cost.STCS002A.BidAskSpread
member.summary: Gets the bid-ask spread.

member.name: P:Alaris.Strategy.Cost.STCS002A.HalfSpread
member.summary: Gets the half-spread (single-side slippage).

member.name: M:Alaris.Strategy.Cost.STCS002A.Validate
member.summary: Validates the order parameters.

member.name: T:Alaris.Strategy.Cost.OrderDirection
member.summary: Specifies the direction of an order.

member.name: F:Alaris.Strategy.Cost.OrderDirection.Buy
member.summary: Buy order (long position entry or short position exit). Fills at ask price in realistic execution.

member.name: F:Alaris.Strategy.Cost.OrderDirection.Sell
member.summary: Sell order (long position exit or short position entry). Fills at bid price in realistic execution.

member.name: T:Alaris.Strategy.Cost.STCS003A
member.summary: Represents the computed execution cost for a single option leg.

remarks.para: This immutable record decomposes execution costs into their constituent components: commission fees, exchange fees, regulatory fees, and slippage. This granularity enables detailed cost attribution and model validation.
Total cost = Commission + ExchangeFees + RegulatoryFees + Slippage

member.name: P:Alaris.Strategy.Cost.STCS003A.Commission
member.summary: Gets the brokerage commission in dollars.
member.remarks: For IBKR equity options, this varies by monthly volume tier: ≤10K contracts: $0.25-$0.70/contract depending on premium.

member.name: P:Alaris.Strategy.Cost.STCS003A.ExchangeFees
member.summary: Gets the exchange fees in dollars.
member.remarks: Exchange fees are charged by the options exchange (e.g., CBOE, NYSE Arca). These are typically passed through by the broker.

member.name: P:Alaris.Strategy.Cost.STCS003A.RegulatoryFees
member.summary: Gets the regulatory fees in dollars (e.g., SEC, FINRA).

member.name: P:Alaris.Strategy.Cost.STCS003A.Slippage
member.summary: Gets the estimated slippage cost in dollars.

remarks.para: Slippage represents the cost of crossing the bid-ask spread. For buy orders: fill at ask (pay half-spread). For sell orders: fill at bid (receive half-spread less).
Computed as: HalfSpread × Contracts × ContractMultiplier

member.name: P:Alaris.Strategy.Cost.STCS003A.TheoreticalPrice
member.summary: Gets the theoretical fill price (mid-price).

member.name: P:Alaris.Strategy.Cost.STCS003A.ExecutionPrice
member.summary: Gets the execution-adjusted fill price.
member.remarks: For buy orders: Ask price (or mid + half-spread). For sell orders: Bid price (or mid - half-spread).

member.name: P:Alaris.Strategy.Cost.STCS003A.Contracts
member.summary: Gets the number of contracts.

member.name: P:Alaris.Strategy.Cost.STCS003A.TotalCost
member.summary: Gets the total execution cost (all components).

member.name: P:Alaris.Strategy.Cost.STCS003A.CostPerContract
member.summary: Gets the cost per contract.

member.name: P:Alaris.Strategy.Cost.STCS003A.SlippagePercent
member.summary: Gets the slippage as a percentage of theoretical value.

member.name: P:Alaris.Strategy.Cost.STCS003A.TotalFees
member.summary: Gets the total fees (excluding slippage).

member.name: T:Alaris.Strategy.Cost.STCS004A
member.summary: Represents the combined execution cost for a calendar spread.

remarks.para: A calendar spread consists of two legs: - Front leg: Sell near-term option (receives premium, pays slippage on bid) - Back leg: Buy far-term option (pays premium, pays slippage on ask)
The net debit/credit is adjusted by execution costs to compute the true entry cost of the position.

member.name: P:Alaris.Strategy.Cost.STCS004A.FrontLegCost
member.summary: Gets the execution cost for the front-month leg.

member.name: P:Alaris.Strategy.Cost.STCS004A.BackLegCost
member.summary: Gets the execution cost for the back-month leg.

member.name: P:Alaris.Strategy.Cost.STCS004A.TheoreticalDebit
member.summary: Gets the theoretical spread debit (mid-price based).
member.remarks: Computed as: BackMidPrice - FrontMidPrice. Positive value indicates a debit spread.

member.name: P:Alaris.Strategy.Cost.STCS004A.ExecutionDebit
member.summary: Gets the execution-adjusted spread debit.

remarks.para: Accounts for bid-ask slippage on both legs: - Buy back-month at ask (higher cost) - Sell front-month at bid (lower proceeds)
ExecutionDebit = BackAsk - FrontBid

member.name: P:Alaris.Strategy.Cost.STCS004A.Contracts
member.summary: Gets the number of spread contracts.

member.name: P:Alaris.Strategy.Cost.STCS004A.ContractMultiplier
member.summary: Gets the contract multiplier (typically 100).

member.name: P:Alaris.Strategy.Cost.STCS004A.TotalSlippage
member.summary: Gets the total slippage across both legs.

member.name: P:Alaris.Strategy.Cost.STCS004A.TotalCommission
member.summary: Gets the total commissions across both legs.

member.name: P:Alaris.Strategy.Cost.STCS004A.TotalFees
member.summary: Gets the total fees across both legs.

member.name: P:Alaris.Strategy.Cost.STCS004A.TotalExecutionCost
member.summary: Gets the total execution cost (fees + slippage).

member.name: P:Alaris.Strategy.Cost.STCS004A.CostPerSpread
member.summary: Gets the cost per spread.

member.name: P:Alaris.Strategy.Cost.STCS004A.SlippagePercent
member.summary: Gets the slippage as a percentage of theoretical debit.
member.remarks: This metric indicates how much execution costs degrade the theoretical edge. A value exceeding 5-10% may indicate insufficient liquidity.

member.name: P:Alaris.Strategy.Cost.STCS004A.TotalCapitalRequired
member.summary: Gets the total dollar amount required to enter the position.
member.remarks: Includes the execution-adjusted debit plus all transaction costs. This is the true capital outlay for the position.

member.name: P:Alaris.Strategy.Cost.STCS004A.TheoreticalCapitalRequired
member.summary: Gets the theoretical capital requirement (mid-price, no fees).

member.name: P:Alaris.Strategy.Cost.STCS004A.ExecutionCostPercent
member.summary: Gets the execution cost as a percentage of theoretical capital.
member.remarks: Used to assess whether the signal edge survives transaction costs. Typical threshold: < 5% for viable strategies.

member.name: T:Alaris.Strategy.Cost.STCS005A
member.summary: Implements a constant per-contract fee model for option execution costs.

remarks.para: This brokerage-agnostic model applies a fixed fee per contract, suitable for: - Initial strategy validation before brokerage integration - Conservative cost estimation with configurable fees - Backtesting scenarios where exact brokerage fees are not required
The model computes slippage by assuming fills occur at bid (sell) or ask (buy) rather than mid-price, providing realistic execution cost estimates.
Reference: Modelled after QuantConnect's ConstantFeeModel pattern.

member.name: F:Alaris.Strategy.Cost.STCS005A.DefaultFeePerContract
member.summary: Default commission fee per contract (conservative estimate).
member.remarks: Based on typical retail option commission: $0.65/contract. IBKR tiered ranges from $0.15 to $0.70 depending on volume and premium.

member.name: F:Alaris.Strategy.Cost.STCS005A.DefaultExchangeFee
member.summary: Default exchange fee per contract.
member.remarks: Exchange fees vary by exchange and order type. Using CBOE average.

member.name: F:Alaris.Strategy.Cost.STCS005A.DefaultRegulatoryFee
member.summary: Default regulatory fee per contract.
member.remarks: Includes SEC, FINRA, and ORF fees (typically small).

member.name: M:Alaris.Strategy.Cost.STCS005A.#ctor(System.Double,System.Double,System.Double,Microsoft.Extensions.Logging.ILogger{Alaris.Strategy.Cost.STCS005A})
member.summary: Initialises a new instance of the constant fee model.
member.exception: Thrown when any fee is negative.

member.name: M:Alaris.Strategy.Cost.STCS005A.SafeLog(System.Action)
member.summary: Safely executes logging operation with fault isolation (Rule 15).

member.name: T:Alaris.Strategy.Cost.STCS006A
member.summary: Validates that trading signals survive execution costs.

remarks.para: This component addresses a critical pre-production requirement: verifying that the theoretical edge identified by signal generation persists after accounting for realistic transaction costs.

The validation process: 1. Computes execution-adjusted spread costs 2. Recalculates effective IV/RV ratio incorporating costs 3. Validates against minimum threshold (default: 1.20 post-costs) 4. Assesses whether the position maintains defined risk properties
Reference: Atilgan (2014) uses IV/RV ≥ 1.25 as entry threshold. Post-cost threshold of 1.20 provides a 5% cost buffer.

member.name: F:Alaris.Strategy.Cost.STCS006A.DefaultMinimumPostCostRatio
member.summary: Default minimum IV/RV ratio after costs.
member.remarks: Set 5% below the entry threshold (1.25) to allow for cost degradation whilst maintaining profitability.

member.name: F:Alaris.Strategy.Cost.STCS006A.DefaultMaximumSlippagePercent
member.summary: Default maximum acceptable slippage percentage.
member.remarks: Slippage exceeding 10% of theoretical debit indicates poor liquidity.

member.name: F:Alaris.Strategy.Cost.STCS006A.DefaultMaximumExecutionCostPercent
member.summary: Default maximum execution cost as percentage of capital.
member.remarks: Total execution costs (fees + slippage) exceeding 5% of capital significantly degrade expected returns.

member.name: M:Alaris.Strategy.Cost.STCS006A.#ctor(Alaris.Strategy.Cost.STCS001A,System.Double,System.Double,System.Double,Microsoft.Extensions.Logging.ILogger{Alaris.Strategy.Cost.STCS006A})
member.summary: Initialises a new instance of the signal cost validator.
member.param: The execution cost model to use.
Minimum IV/RV ratio after costs. Default: 1.20.
Maximum execution cost as percentage of capital. Default: 5%.

member.name: M:Alaris.Strategy.Cost.STCS006A.Validate(Alaris.Strategy.Core.STCR004A,Alaris.Strategy.Cost.STCS002A,Alaris.Strategy.Cost.STCS002A)
member.summary: Validates that a signal survives execution costs.
member.exception: Thrown when any parameter is null.

member.name: M:Alaris.Strategy.Cost.STCS006A.ComputePostCostRatio(System.Double,Alaris.Strategy.Cost.STCS004A)
member.summary: Computes the post-cost IV/RV ratio.
member.param: The original IV/RV ratio from signal generation.
member.returns: The adjusted IV/RV ratio accounting for costs.

remarks.para: The cost adjustment follows this logic: - The IV/RV ratio measures the premium of implied volatility over realised - Execution costs effectively reduce the captured premium - We model this as a proportional reduction based on cost percentage
Post-cost ratio = Pre-cost ratio × (1 - ExecutionCostPercent/100)

This is a conservative approximation. A more precise computation would recompute expected P&L under cost-adjusted entry prices, but this requires additional market data (expected IV crush magnitude, holding period).

member.name: M:Alaris.Strategy.Cost.STCS006A.ValidateBatch(System.Collections.Generic.IReadOnlyList{System.ValueTuple{Alaris.Strategy.Core.STCR004A,Alaris.Strategy.Cost.STCS002A,Alaris.Strategy.Cost.STCS002A}})
member.summary: Validates multiple signals in batch.
member.param: Collection of signals with their corresponding option parameters.

member.summary: Safely executes logging operation with fault isolation (Rule 15).

A signal is considered production-ready when: - Post-cost IV/RV ratio ≥ minimum threshold (default: 1.20) - Slippage percentage ≤ maximum threshold (default: 10%) - Total execution cost ≤ maximum threshold (default: 5% of capital)

member.name: T:Alaris.Strategy.Cost.STCS008A
member.summary: Validates that position sizing is appropriate given instrument liquidity.

remarks.para: This component addresses the critical assumption that "Max Loss = Debit Paid" holds for calendar spread positions. This assumption is only valid when the back-month option has sufficient liquidity to exit under stress conditions.

Validation criteria: - Position-to-Volume ratio: Ensures the position can be exited within a reasonable fraction of daily volume. - Position-to-OpenInterest ratio: Ensures the position does not represent an outsized share of market interest, which would impact exit prices.
Institutional thresholds: ≤5% of daily volume, ≤2% of open interest.

member.name: F:Alaris.Strategy.Cost.STCS008A.DefaultMaxVolumeRatio
member.summary: Default maximum position-to-volume ratio.
member.remarks: 5% of average daily volume ensures the position can be exited without significantly impacting market prices.

member.name: F:Alaris.Strategy.Cost.STCS008A.DefaultMaxOpenInterestRatio
member.summary: Default maximum position-to-open-interest ratio.
member.remarks: 2% of open interest prevents becoming a significant market participant whose exit could move prices adversely.

member.name: T:Alaris.Strategy.Hedge.STHD001A
member.summary: Analyses the correlation between front-month and back-month implied volatility changes to assess calendar spread vega independence.

remarks.para: Calendar spread profitability depends on the front-month IV crushing (dropping) whilst the back-month IV holds steady. If both legs move in lockstep (high correlation), the spread offers no diversification benefit and may result in sympathetic volatility collapse.
The key metric is the Pearson correlation coefficient between daily IV changes in front and back tenors. A correlation below 0.70 suggests sufficient independence for the calendar spread thesis.
Reference: Empirically, event-driven front-month volatility tends to decouple from baseline back-month volatility as earnings approach.

member.name: F:Alaris.Strategy.Hedge.STHD001A.DefaultMaxCorrelation
member.summary: Default maximum acceptable correlation coefficient.
member.remarks: Correlation below 0.70 indicates sufficient independence between front and back tenor volatility movements.

member.name: F:Alaris.Strategy.Hedge.STHD001A.DefaultMinimumObservations
member.summary: Default minimum number of observations required.
member.remarks: At least 20 observations (trading days) provide statistical significance for correlation estimation.

member.name: M:Alaris.Strategy.Hedge.STHD001A.#ctor(System.Double,System.Int32,Microsoft.Extensions.Logging.ILogger{Alaris.Strategy.Hedge.STHD001A})
member.summary: Initialises a new instance of the vega correlation analyser.
member.exception: Thrown when correlation threshold is not in [-1, 1] or observations < 3.

Thrown when arrays have different lengths.

member.name: T:Alaris.Strategy.Hedge.STHD003A
member.summary: Monitors and manages gamma risk for calendar spread positions.

remarks.para: Calendar spreads have negative gamma: they profit when the underlying stays near the strike but lose when it moves significantly. This component monitors delta drift and gamma exposure, triggering re-hedging when thresholds are breached.

Key scenarios: - Underlying moves away from strike → Delta increases → Position becomes directional - Pre-earnings gap risk → Potential for significant overnight movement - Time decay asymmetry → Front leg decays faster, delta profile shifts
This addresses the "set and forget" error by enforcing active position management.

member.name: F:Alaris.Strategy.Hedge.STHD003A.DefaultDeltaThreshold
member.summary: Default delta threshold triggering re-centering.
member.remarks: When absolute delta exceeds 0.10, the position has become directionally biased and should be re-centred at the current ATM strike.

member.name: F:Alaris.Strategy.Hedge.STHD003A.DefaultGammaThreshold
member.summary: Default gamma threshold for warnings.
member.remarks: Gamma more negative than -0.05 indicates elevated convexity risk.

member.name: F:Alaris.Strategy.Hedge.STHD003A.DefaultMoneynessThreshold
member.summary: Default moneyness alert threshold.
member.remarks: When underlying moves more than 3% from strike, risk profile changes materially.

member.summary: Initialises a new instance of the gamma risk manager.
member.exception: Thrown when thresholds are outside valid ranges.

member.summary: Orchestrates all pre-trade validations for production deployment.

remarks.para: This component integrates the four key validation components: 1. Execution cost validation (signal survives transaction costs) 2. Vega correlation analysis (front/back tenor independence) 3. Liquidity validation (defined risk assumption holds) 4. Gamma risk assessment (initial position parameters acceptable)
A signal is production-ready only when ALL validations pass.

member.name: T:Alaris.Strategy.Pricing.STPR001APricing
member.summary: Contains pricing and risk metrics for a calendar spread position. A calendar spread buys a longer-dated option and sells a shorter-dated option at the same strike.

member.name: P:Alaris.Strategy.Pricing.STPR001APricing.FrontOption
member.summary: Gets or sets the pricing details for the front-month (short) option.

member.name: P:Alaris.Strategy.Pricing.STPR001APricing.BackOption
member.summary: Gets or sets the pricing details for the back-month (long) option.

member.name: P:Alaris.Strategy.Pricing.STPR001APricing.SpreadCost
member.summary: Gets or sets the net cost of the calendar spread (debit paid). SpreadCost = BackOption.Price - FrontOption.Price

member.name: P:Alaris.Strategy.Pricing.STPR001APricing.SpreadDelta
member.summary: Gets or sets the net delta of the spread.

member.name: P:Alaris.Strategy.Pricing.STPR001APricing.SpreadGamma
member.summary: Gets or sets the net gamma of the spread.

member.name: P:Alaris.Strategy.Pricing.STPR001APricing.SpreadVega
member.summary: Gets or sets the net vega of the spread. Calendar spreads are long vega (benefit from IV increase).

member.name: P:Alaris.Strategy.Pricing.STPR001APricing.SpreadTheta
member.summary: Gets or sets the net theta of the spread. Calendar spreads benefit from time decay of the front-month option.

member.name: P:Alaris.Strategy.Pricing.STPR001APricing.SpreadRho
member.summary: Gets or sets the net rho of the spread.

member.name: P:Alaris.Strategy.Pricing.STPR001APricing.MaxProfit
member.summary: Gets or sets the maximum theoretical profit. Typically occurs when underlying is at strike at front-month expiration.

member.name: P:Alaris.Strategy.Pricing.STPR001APricing.MaxLoss
member.summary: Gets or sets the maximum loss (limited to the debit paid).

member.name: P:Alaris.Strategy.Pricing.STPR001APricing.BreakEven
member.summary: Gets or sets the breakeven price at front-month expiration.

member.name: P:Alaris.Strategy.Pricing.STPR001APricing.ProfitLossRatio
member.summary: Gets the profit/loss ratio.

member.name: P:Alaris.Strategy.Pricing.STPR001APricing.HasPositiveExpectedValue
member.summary: Gets whether the spread has positive expected value based on IV/RV ratio.

member.name: M:Alaris.Strategy.Pricing.STPR001APricing.Validate
member.summary: Validates the calendar spread pricing is internally consistent.

member.summary: Gets or sets the option delta (∂Price/∂Underlying). Measures sensitivity to underlying price changes. Range: [0, 1] for calls, [-1, 0] for puts.

member.name: P:Alaris.Strategy.Pricing.OptionPricing.Gamma
member.summary: Gets or sets the option gamma (∂Delta/∂Underlying). Measures the rate of change of delta.

member.name: P:Alaris.Strategy.Pricing.OptionPricing.Theta
member.summary: Gets or sets the option theta (∂Price/∂Time). Measures time decay (typically negative).

member.name: P:Alaris.Strategy.Pricing.OptionPricing.Rho
member.summary: Gets or sets the option rho (∂Price/∂Rate). Measures sensitivity to interest rate changes.

member.summary: Gets or sets the implied volatility used in pricing.

member.summary: Gets or sets the time to expiration in years.

member.name: P:Alaris.Strategy.Pricing.OptionPricing.Moneyness
member.summary: Gets or sets the moneyness (Underlying / Strike).

member.name: T:Alaris.Strategy.Risk.STRK001A
member.summary: Implements Kelly Criterion position sizing for options strategies. Uses fractional Kelly (typically 25% of full Kelly) for safety.

member.summary: Calculates position size based on historical trade performance. Kelly Formula: f* = (p*b - q) / b where p = win probability, q = loss probability, b = win/loss ratio
